Tunable.name: DEFAULT_SCORE_CUTOFF
Tunable.description: Transforms scoring below cutoff * max_score are filtered out when joining / adjusting position

TunableList.name: GROUP_ANGLE_CURVE
TunableList.description: A curve defining the score for two Sims with this facing angle (in radians). An angle of zero (on the x-axis) means a Sims is facing another Sim, while PI means a Sim is facing away. Higher values (on the y-axis) encourage that angular facing.

TunableList.name: GROUP_DISTANCE_CURVE
TunableList.description: A curve defining the score for standing a given distance away from other Sims in the social group. Higher values (on the y-axis) encourage standing at that distance (on the x-axis) away from other Sims.

TunableList.name: NON_GROUP_DISTANCE_CURVE
TunableList.description: A curve defining the score for standing a given distance away from other Sims *not* in the social group. Higher values (on the y-axis) encourage standing at that distance (on the x-axis) away from other Sims.

Tunable.name: NON_OVERLAPPING_SCORE_MULTIPLIER
Tunable.description: Minimum score multiplier for non-overlapping fields

Tunable.name: OVERLAP_SCORE_MULTIPLIER
Tunable.description: p Higher values raise the importance of the 'personal space' component of the social scoring function.

Tunable.name: SCORE_OFFSET_FOR_CURRENT_POSITION
Tunable.description: An additional score to apply to points that are virtually identical to the Sim's current position if the Sim already has an entry in the geometry. Larger numbers provide more friction that will prevent Sims from moving away from their current position unless the score of the new point makes moving worthwhile.

Tunable.name: SCORE_STRENGTH_MULTIPLIER
Tunable.description: Values > 1 will cause Sims to go further out of their way to be in perfect social arrangements. This helps overcome distance attenuation for social adjustment since we want Sims to care more about where they are positioned than how far they have to go to improve that position.
